Blog.post: urlLink Rudolph Valentino! While I am on the subject of favorites I have to talk about my favorite actor Rudolph Valentino. Everyone asks me how did you get interested in a actor that has been dead since the mid 1920's. When I was young my mom had a book on Hollywood stars and I remember seeing Valentino and thought he was very cool looking. There was also a photo of his lying in his casket at his funeral. I thought it was very strange/cool. When I was about twenty I was up late watching AMC and they said coming up next The Sheik starring Rudolph Valentino. I thought it would be cool to stay up and watch the movie and tape it for my mom. As I was watching it I thought it was really interesting and it was so late that I feel asleep. The next day I finished watching it and after that I was hooked. I have all of his movies and a whole room downstairs full of Valentino collectibles. When most people see this room for the first time there is silence and then they slowly walk out and look at the rest of the house. I am sure that most people think I am completely nuts or totally obsessed. Oh well whatever my collection is worth a lot of money and I enjoy collecting it. Let me tell you a little about Valentino. He was born on May 6, 1895 in Castellaneta, Italy. His real "birth" name is Rodolfo Alfonzo Raffaelo Pierre Filibert Guglielmi di Valentina D'Antonguolla. Say that fast five times. Anyway he came from a modest family in Italy and deceided to travel to America when he was 18 in 1913. He was adventurous and wanted to try a life in America. He held many odd jobs and around the age of 20 he got a job as a dancer with a well known dancer named Bonnie Glass. He was known simply as Signor Rodolfo. During this time dancers were more popular than movie stars. After his short dancing career he got a part in a play called Nobody Home which folded in San Franciso. He met up with a actor named Norman Kerry who told him to try Hollywood. He got Valentino a bit dancing part in a 1917 movie called Alimony. He had various bit parts in various movies over the next three years. Finally in 1920 he appeared in a movie called Eyes of Youth. Hollywood's most powerful woman at the time, June Mathis saw the performance and convinced the studio to cast Valentino in the lead for the movie The Four Horseman of the Apocalypse. The studios were first reluctant due to the fact that there had never been a "foreign" lead and they did not think the public would be favorable to it. Later that year he landed another leading role in a movie called The Sheik. He was a star overnight. Women everywhere were crazy over Valentino. He quickly became the first lover/sex symbol of the screen. In 1922 on the set of the movie Camille he met the set designer, her name was Natasha Rambova. They instantly fell in love and were married. Unfortunately she controlled his life and his career. She had a very strong power over him. I feel that he truly loved her and was blind to what was going on around him. Valentino was hot and studios wanted him, however Natasha demanded specific roles, scripts, you name it. Valentino and the studios clashed and he walked out on his contract. A year later he came back but in his contract it stated that Natasha was to have no involvement in any part of the production. Valentino hesitantly agreed and soon after the marriage crumbled. She left him and left for New York. Valentino was heart broken. He then began to live the life of a movie star, he dated, spent money and had extravagant parties. In 1926 he made a sequel to his blockbuster hit The Sheik, The Son of the Sheik. He was promoting the movie in New York when he collapsed in his hotel room. He was taked to the hospital where he was diagnosed with a perforated gastric ulcer and a infection. He was in the hospital for 7 days where he slipped into a coma and died on August 23, 1926. After his death was annoucned there was panic. To this day there has never been such pandemonium take place after a celebrities death. Women reportedly committed suicide. There was a riot in the streets of New York at The Campbells Funeral home where Valentino was laid to rest. The crowed rushed through the plate glass window in the front of the buliding to get a glipse of Valentino. The next day the police on horseback contolled the crowd of over 100,000 people. They allowed the public to view the open casket inside in a single file line. He was later laid to rest in Hollywood Memorial Cemetery. He is in a vault next to June Mathis, which she owned when he died. After Valentino died Natasha did not attend the funeral, in his will he left her $1, and not one penny more. One intersting fact about Valentino he holds the record for the shortest Hollywood marriage. When he was younger before Natasha he married a co-star named Jean Acker. They became close friends and in a whirl-wind relationship became married. On their wedding night she locked him out of their hotel room. Valentino was unaware that Jean Acker was a lesbian and there was a interlocutory divorce soon after. I have been a fan/collector of Valentino for about tweleve years now. If anyone out there is a collector or has some Valentino items you want to get rid of, be sure to let me know! Check out the urlLink Valetino Homepage . This is the best Valentino webstie out there! urlLink

urlLink Ok, I have to start this off with my favorite movie of all time, urlLink JFK . Besides being a big movie buff I am also really into the Kennedy assassination. So of course this movie is perfect for me. I have done quite a bit of research on the JFK assassination and this movie is very accurate. The movie is based on the life of Jim Garrison, who was the District Attorney of New Orleans when Kennedy was assassinated. Since Lee Harvey Oswald had been linked to various people in New Orleans in the summer of 1963 Jim Garrison brought in a few of these people for questioning. One of the people he brought in was David Ferrie. David Ferrie had served in Oswald's Civil Air Patrol Unit years earlier. They had remained acquaintances throughout the years. After questioning Ferrie about the actual events of November 22nd 1963 and his known association with Lee Harvey Oswald he felt that Ferrie was making up his whereabouts. He then turned Ferrie over to the F.B.I. for further questioning. The F.B.I questioned Ferrie and then released him. After releasing Ferrie the F.B.I. in a press conference announced that they had questioned a suspect named David Ferrie and that he had no connection to the case, they also stated that he had been brought into be questioned by the District of New Olreans Parrish not the F.B.I. At the time Garrison had no idea why the F.B.I. released this suspect which he felt was closely timed to the case. He got passed it and moved on with his life. Three years later in a chance conversation with Senator Russell Long of Louisiana the JFK assassination came up again. Senator Long told Garrison that the whole thing was a joke. He told Garrison that it was absolutely impossible for Oswald to squeeze off three shots from a manual bolt action rifle in less than six seconds from the sixth floor of a office buliding. Long went on to say that he heard that Oswald was at best a medium shot from his training when he was in the U.S. Marines. The conversation changed Jim's life from there on. After now doubting some of the events that took place that day he meet up with his team that worked along side him everyday in New Orleans. He told his team that they were going back into the case of the killing of the President. The movie depicts Jim's trials and tribulations throughout this period. Many people don't realize until seeing this movie that Jim Garrison was a patriot and a hero. He put his career, his reputation and his family on the line to pursue the truth behind the assassination. Without Jim Garrison's efforts we would not have a lot of the unexplained evidence that we have today. The cinematography in this movie is absolutely unbelievable. The movie uses a lot of quick camera movements and also black and white flash backs. There are also a lot of scenes where various characters are planted that you have to keep your eyes open for. The Cast: I have never seen a movie before or one since that has the star power of JFK. First off there were many real life people in the movie that were associated to the case. Jim Garrison himself was in the movie, he played Chief Justice Earl Warren. Also Perry Russo who was a key witness in the Clay Shaw trial and the man who restored the Zapruder film and JFK assassination researcher Robert Groden was in the film. As far as Hollywood star power: Kevin Costner, Gary Oldman, Sissy Spacek, Jack Lemmon, Walter Matthau, John Candy, Tommy Lee Jones, Joe Pesci, Kevin Bacon, Ed Asner, Donald Sutherland and Vincent D'Onofrio. This is by far Kevin Costner's best performance. He was nominated for the Acamdey Award for best actor. However, he lost to Anthony Hopkins for his peroformance of Hannibal Lector in Silence of the Lambs. I feel that Costner definately gave the better performance that year but I felt that the controversial film lead to his loss. The most pivotal part of Costner's performance was toward the end of the movie during the courtroom scene. If you have not seen JFK go rent it buy it whatever. Enjoy this fantastic movie on a very controversial subject and judge for yourself. urlLink

urlLink 1 urlLink "Goodfellas and Sopranos" urlLink 2 urlLink The Sopranos is one of my favorite television shows. Goodfellas is one of my favorite movies. I always see people in Sopranos that I recognize from Goodfellas. When Princess of Power and I are watching The Sopranos I am always like "hey, he is from Goodfellas". She is always like "yeah". Who else thinks it's completely great and utterly lazy to have a Krispy Kreme drive-thru? The other day while feeding the compulsive shopping monster that lives inside me, I happened upon Krispy Kreme. I thought, "I could just go through the drive-thru real quick like and get an Original Glazed and a Dean's chocolate milk." Coming from a disparing-skirt-trying-on session, this seemed to be just the cure. As I was furiously searching for the $2.17 I needed to pay for my .45 seconds of pure food heaven I thought this is completely lazy/great. I also felt like a lard ass. It was great. Long Live Krispy Kreme.

Presidential Candidates who could not win a high school debate - part one As those who know me well should know, there are few things that light my fire of interest like the sparks of a presidential campaign. With the November fifth date less than a half year away the torrential tides of political propaganda are saturating the shores. The overwhelming responsibility of the American people is to sift through the sand of misrepresentations, misstatements and mendacity in search of any remaining grains of non-partisan truth. In order to assist the blog readers in this tedious task I will make it the goal of my writings to right the wrongs of the partisan press. The democrats ('de-m&-"krat), are once again being led by a Roman Catholic liberal from Massachusetts with the popular initials J.F.K., but don't get your hopes up, the comparisons quickly dwindle. Is John F. Kerry the John F. Kennedy of our generation? I vote no. With a consistent record of inconsistencies in public policy opinions, Kerry's semantics are already wearing on the I-won't-vote-for-you-just-because-you-are-a-democrat crowd. Kerry is known in Republican circles as a "flip flop" and that has nothing to do with his manner of dress (though that also could stand a bit of scrutiny), or a particular affinity for pool-shoes. He was issued this good-humored nickname as a result of his inability to make up his mind on key issues. He wanted our troops in our Iraq, and yet he does not want to provide the funding necessary to complete the mission which he VOTED to begin. He appears very proud of his service in Vietnam, and yet he finds himself in a middle school fight about the difference in the definitions of ribbons and medals. It may sound as if I would be singing the praises of the president, and advocating his re-election, but the truth is that there are thousands of things that threaten the country and the country's stability if we choose to travel that path as well. What is the answer? I will proudly post that as soon as I figure it out. Until then, I will tackle the tough topics on the blog, beginning next time with the issues of the Bush campaign. Until then, please elect to keep up with the election details, you can't expect me to do all of the work for you!

I'm ticklish. Very ticklish. At my new place of employment, I was recently chastized for being this way. At the Spag-o, they seem to have a shrunken personal space issue. Bumping into people is one thing, just touching them because you think you can is quite another. Many of my fellow employees feel a compulsion to randomly jab, poke, pinch, stroke, and generally fondle one another during work hours. Now don't get me wrong I'm no prude, I'm just not that touchy of a person...maybe I didn't get enough hugs as a youth or something! Whatever the reason, I'm not a stranger-toucher, or even an acquaintence-toucher. What bugs me is the touchers who violate the weary touchees and then get all offended when the touchee seems a bit alarmed. Am I crazy? Well, yeah, but this touching has got to stop!

Hello all! Its the Donald of Gold here, at least in the eyes of one Tom "Dangerfield" Miller! Closing out this hellish week with my numero uno blog entry is quite exciting, although I seem to be at a loss for something clever to say...? Instead of whipping up a tale of full of cockamamie stories and dripping with wit, I will simply speak freely on the subject closest to my heart at the moment....people who think their shit don't stink. These people roam freely about the land, yet none so obnoxiously as a man child I know who calls himself Phil. To begin, unless it is preceded immediately by Punxsutawney, Phil is the worst name ever. Name one decent person named Phil....alright, well I'm sure there is one, but until he kicks it, NO ONE else should go by that name (No, Donahue doesn't count). Anyway, this guy Phil is so full of crap its coming out his eyeballs, yet he thinks he's God's chunky, curly headed, white gift to the world. He is not. He is one of those people who uses big words erroneously (much love Mr. Gere) and then repeats them over and over in conversation, has pauses where they are not necessary, and has no idea when he is having body odor issues. But the thing that really irks me about this mofo is his compulsion to sneer at my palm pilot keyboard. He, of course, is also the proud owner of a Palm, (one without a color screen I noted last time I spied him playing 2-tone solitaire) but he has no keyboard. I know that most people, me included, consider the owners of Palm keyboards in the upper echelon of society, but this kid says to me a while ago "I was gonna get one of those but then I thought it might be kind of dumb." What?? Yeah, those are the kind of people that drive me to drink...well, them and everyone else I encounter in life haha...jj! OK, as I must venture back to the almost-finished world of college, I will end this, my very first blog entry. While I never intended it to be this way, I'm sure Ol' Phil would be pleased as pie to see that I gave him so much page space in this entry....if you see him, go ahead and tell him, he will surely suprise you with a biting reply. Big ups to my soul sister Audra for getting our asses in gear on the blog! L. Von Hatty's Question of the Blog 4.23.04 - Can you lick your elbow? Yeah, I didn't think so!!

Black Thorn Pub Ok last night we went out to Black Thorn Pub, which was recently named a top place for deep dish pizzas in STL. We had a few drinks, listened to $5.00 worth of jukebox and still didn't have our damn pizza. A nice beer buzz was starting to give way to food-depraved anger. It didn't help that the bartender was a complete b about it. Eventually we got the pizza, AFTER 2 HOURS and we each only had 2 pieces since we were full of drink. All and all it was ok but the pizza sure wasn't worth A 2 HOUR WAIT. My advice is call ahead if you want a gd pizza before Christmas.

This One's for the Children: Lesson 1, The Special Needs Child For those not in the education field, let me enlighten you. Each student that is diagnosed (medically) with a disability must have an Individualized Education Plan (IEP). It outlines goals, deadlines, and accommodations that MUST be performed in the classroom. This is a legal document and failure to follow it could result in (you guessed it) legal action against the teachers. Now, let me take you back a few months to when I was still student teaching... A student in homeroom is misbehaving right before the bell rings for end of the day dismissal. The bell (finally) rings and the "real" teacher who I am working with starts talking to me. Her: He's a special kid. (Then proceeds to tell me about the other times she has had him in class and he's misbehaved and how his accommodations are outrageous, and she didn't follow him.) Me: Were these things the IEP outlined? Her: Yes. Me: Oh, well, what is he diagnosed with? Her: I don't know. They didn't tell me. Me: (trying to feign innocence) It wasn't on the IEP? Her: No, they didn't show me that part. THAT IS UTTERLY AND COMPLETELY WRONG!! THE DISABILITY IS WRITTEN TO TOP OF THE IEP!! WHAT'S THE POINT IN HAVING AN IEP IF NO ONE KNOW WHAT MEDICAL CONDITION THE STUDENT HAS!?!?!? Just an example of why I'm not teaching. I cannot be around people who don't do their job. A teacher who does not follow an IEP is not doing their job. (side note: any special educators out there that know more about the IEP process and discover that my findings are wrong....please let me know. I would hate to hold a mental grudge against that teacher when I there is no need). I'm usually not that angry. However, the discovery that I've wasted 3 years of my life does tend to get under my collar.

I began complaining to B about how degrading this show was and blah blah blah. I concluded my rant by surmising that while it was all of these things I would do it if given the chance! Thank God for the light Shortly after my last post, I woke urlLink B up because I found out that the urlLink sunrise was happening at 4:44am this morning and we should watch it. urlLink B was very confused because I had woke him several times previous to this out of complete mental terror. So this time, he fully woke and we went outside to watch the sun come up. It was strangely void of people noise but heavy on the nature sounds. I thought to myself, this is why I don't camp. It's too damn loud. In the driveway I told urlLink B of my fear of Silas and we talked about trout fishing. He concluded that perhaps my sun information was not in CST and it meant 5:44. The sky was lightening up but no actual sun to be seen. We decided that we were starved so we went to the grocery store to get stuff for breakfast. The grocery store at 5:00am is kind of a mess. There were boxes laying around and scary convict looking cashiers in the front. We got what we needed and headed out to watch the sunrise and read the Sunday paper. Very quaint I know. Well the sun was masked by the damn clouds so we didn't technically see it after all this work but I am now informed about the deseg issues in the Clayton school district (thank you Bill McClellan.) We went home and urlLink B made pancakes and snausages. It was great, filling the void that the crab rangoon had left. We washed the dishes and went back to bed. I got up about an hour ago. It's going to be a bitch getting up for work tomorrow. My sunburn hurts.

The Magical World of Tivo!! I feel that Tivo is the most undiscovered miracle to come around in a long time. We have had Tivo for about three months now and it is absolutely scrumtralesant. All of your favorite T.V. shows at your fingertips at all times. Set it to tape one show or a season pass which tapes the whole season. You can even set it to tape everything that one specific actor appears in. You can pause it, fast forward it or instant replay it. After using Tivo you tend to look at your blank VHS tapes as if they were 8-tracks. What in the hell did we do in our life before Tivo, or as my dad refers to it - "Tibo." One of the funniest things about Tivo is trying to explain it to someone who does not have it or has never used it. They always ask what is the big deal? How does it work? When you start to explain it to them in detail and explain that you can pause live T.V. if you want, they become disoriented. They look at your Tivo and its remote as if they were urlLink Unfrozen Caveman Lawyer looking at a cell phone for the first time. "This Tivo is very strange to me I don't understand you making the T.V. stop." It's like magic to them and they want to know how and when they can get their own. It is as if they woke up and Hagrid is taking them shopping in Daigon Alley. In conclusion I feel a bit brain washed since owning my Tivo. I find myself explaining the magical world of Tivo to everyone I get a chance to. Gotta go to make sure my SNL season pass is set!

Target: If you stock T.P. for 3 hours, we will give you a free bottle of overpriced shampoo I have recently become employed by the discount retailer Target. It has come to my attention in this short time that accepting this position is likely to be counterproductive to my goal of saving money. I think that it is all part of the Target master plan, and it is brilliant. Plan Plank One: HIRING - Target hires employess from all walks of life. They range in age, ethnicity, sex, sexual orientation and intelligence, however they all possess one common trait. They are all BROKE, or at least I assume that they are. Otherwise, why in God's name would they be stocking one-ply toilet paper for 8 hours? Plan Plank Two: WAGE - Pay your employess as little as you can manage without risking their declinig the position. When filling out applications, allow prospective employees to choose from one of three pay ranges. No matter which pay range they choose, call them in for an interview. They will be so excited about having an interview that they will take the job even after you break the bad news that they will be paid from the first, and lowest, pay bracket Plan Plank Three: THE DISCOUNT - At the beginning of the orientation, discuss with new team members the discount you will be offering them. After four long hours of disseminating ridiculous company information to your now sleeping employees, whisper to them that the discount is just 10%. Wake them up. Plan Plank Four: TURN THEM LOOSE - Ensuring that the employees remember that they get a discount (but never again mentioning the amount) turn them loose on the sales floor. Happily watch them gather the merchandise that they are going to purchase on their breaks and lunch. Laugh your best evil laugh as you watch them spend more than they will make. And this, ladies and gentlemen, is how Target actually makes money off of their employees. Their labor costs are at 0. But who is complaining? If they had to pay people to work how could they continue to bring us new products, like Biolage', which I spent 3 hours worth of pay to buy.

Commercials There are two new commercials that are the worst: Hamburger Helper: the new Hamburger Helper man has this ridiculous voice. He sounds like a little girl. Pepto Bismol: This new commercial is ridiculous - have you seen it? There is a line of people waiting for a copier that bust out in this song, grabbing the appropriate body parts as the song plays on: Nausea, heartburn, indigestion, upset stomach, diarrhea, yay Pepto Bismol! I love the little dance. C'mon everybody now! Nausea, heartburn, indigestion, upset stomach, diarrhea, yay Pepto Bismol! For further research I went to the Pepto Bismol website and found this in the FAQ's: How do I open the bottles of Pepto-Bismol Liquid? TO OPEN: Lightly squeeze both tabs located on each side of the neck of the package and turn the cap at the SAME time. TO CLOSE: Screw the cap back on (without squeezing the tabs) until it clicks. Is this really a question that someone needs to go to the Internet for? You can't figure it out without the assistance of the World Wide Web? If you are that much need of the PB, poke a hole in the bottom and shotgun it like a beer. Here are two more FAQ's: I noticed that Pepto-Bismol sometimes darkens the tongue/stool. Why does this happen and how long does it last? The active ingredient in Pepto-Bismol contains bismuth. When a small amount of bismuth combines with trace amounts of sulfur in your saliva and gastrointestinal tract, a black-colored substance (bismuth sulfide) is formed. This discoloration is temporary and harmless. It can last several days after you stop taking Pepto-Bismol. Individual bowel habits, your age (the intestinal tract slows down with age), and the amount of the product taken all help to determine how long Pepto-Bismol is in your system. and What do I do if I spill Pepto-Bismol and it leaves a stain? * For carpet stains, please note: If your carpet has a manufacturer's warranty, you need to contact the manufacturer for their stain removal instructions before you attempt to remove the stain. The manufacturer can refuse to honor the warranty if you use something other than what they recommend. Pepto-Bismol Liquid Staining * If the carpet does not have a stain warranty, proceed with the following recommendations...blah blah blah First off, why are you inspecting your shit so closely? Your tongue I can see but the toliet bowl? Gross. I also wonder if there was enough questions posed to the company regarding the shit that it had to become one of their FAQ's?! Secondly, are people really spilling this much PB on their carpets? Use your fucking head - how would you clean up any other stain, idiot?

Sundays Sundays are bittersweet in that they are the end of the weekend but also a nice end to the hectic week. Usually on Sunday's we do laundry, homework, maybe cut the grass, and pickup the house. All this is preparation for an evening of HBO enjoyment. I like hanging out with B all day, basically doing nothing, save the errant trip to the grocery store or something. On Sunday nights, I usually find that I can't sleep. I don't know whether this is in anticipation of the upcoming weeks events or whether I slept too late and I am just not tired yet. At any rate, come Monday a.m. I am usually wide awake. This is a strange phenomenon seeing as I am not a morning person and no other day of the week is the recipient of this bright-eyed, bushy tailed feeling. I may crash by one o'clock today....

Husbands So I have some friends who love to hate their husbands. At any given point, their husband is a total asshole, then they do one nice thing and they are the king of the free world. What is this passive-aggressive behavior? It's one thing to argue with your spouse but it is entirely another to consistently take a rash of shit from them. I guess because women love to bitch, this behavior is more prevalent in the female gender? I think it's not being able to stand up for yourself.

Going out So I am tired of going out. We go out say, every weekend. It is becoming hella ass boring. It is expensive and it is becoming more and more common to get THE WORST service after you have spent anywhere in the range of 40-100 bucks. It's actually funny. Consider the following example: We are at Mike & Mins in Soulard. Months ago, we swore we would never go there to eat after a horrible service related experience at lunch. True to our word, we hadn't been there in nearly a year. Until last night. We were fiending for some of their excellent pretzel sticks, warm with hot cheese dipping sauce. You really can't find these anywhere else. Our minds, fuzzy from anticipation of these delectable carbs, we had all but forgotten our resolve made so many months earlier. Until Waitress #1 came back and said they are out of Kaluhua. (Sidenote: we had been at a bar previous that was out of Bacardi - a mortal sin for a bar in our opinion.) This is accompanies the fact that W and B could hardly taste the Bacardi in the drinks they had just received - they had to be sent back. (They needed a man's drink - ha.) We placed our food order, complete with the pretzels, when Waitress #1 comes back, and informs us that they are out of cheese, a crucial part of the pretzel snacks. She offered us honey mustard and/or marinara. (When did marinara become an acceptable accompaniment to pretzels I wondered?) I chose the honey mustard. B asked her to melt some cheese into a cup which I thought was hilarious. In the meantime, I ordered a hurricane. It took about....25 minutes to get the twelve thousand dollar glass of indigestion with a straw. It took so long that B had to go up to the bar and pick it up himself. As soon as he gets back, Waitress #2 brings us a hurricane. Keep in mind, I already had one. She was confused. The tardy hurricane was dismissed and sent packing, back to the bar. Finally the food comes, and there is no honey mustard because - you guessed it - they were out. I was like Waitress #1 just offered it when she gave us the bad cheese news and the waitress #2 said, "We are always out of something at this bar." Oh - that's a great answer #2. We get COLD marinara and B asks again for someone to melt some cheese into a cup. Blah blah blah - we get the bill and we are charged for three GD hurricanes. We are like, yeah take two of these off the bill. By this point, Waitress #1 has returned and goes off to correct the bill. She comes back and runs our card to complete the transaction. Upon reexamination of the bill, B sees that we were charged for 2 hurricanes still. 6 hours and 16 carbon receipts later, finally we are free to go. This is just one example of why I am sick of going out. B never did get his cheese melted into a cup.

Can you believe this? Man's dead body lies undisturbed for two decades in Tokyo apartment Associated Press 06/10/2004 TOKYO (AP) -- The decomposed body of a man dressed in pajamas was discovered in an abandoned Tokyo apartment building 20 years after he is believed to have died, police said Thursday. A Tokyo Metropolitan Police official said construction workers were preparing to tear down the building earlier this month when they found the man's skeletal remains laying face-up on a mattress on the tatami reed mat floor of a second-floor room. The morning edition of a newspaper dated Feb. 20, 1984 was on a table nearby and a calendar, opened to the same month, hung on the wall, said the official, who refused to be identified. The official would not say how the man died. Newspaper reports quoted police as saying that there were no signs of struggle, which led investigators to believe he died of an illness. The man, identified only as former worker of the company that built the apartments, was in his mid-50s when he divorced his wife, left home and moved into the building in the early 1980s, the official said. Police believe the man had been unable to repay bank loans and had stopped showing up for work, according to the newspaper reports. But nobody noticed his death because the real estate agency managing the property went out of business after the building was completed in 1973 without ever having found renters, he said. The building had been unoccupied since it was completed. The man's remains have been returned to his ex-wife, the official said.

Toliet Humor I was barely sitting down when I heard a voice from the other stall saying: "Hi, how are you?" I'm not the type to start a conversation in the men's restroom but I don't know what got into me, so I answered, somewhat embarrassed, "Doin' just fine!" And the other guy says: "So what are you up to?" What kind of question is that? At that point, I'm thinking this is too bizarre so I say: "Uhhh, I'm like you, just traveling!" At this point I am just trying to get out as fast as I can when I hear another question. "Can I come over?" Ok, this question is just too weird for me but I figured I could just be polite and end the conversation. I tell him, "No........I'm a little busy right now!!!" Then I hear the guy say nervously... "Listen, I'll have to call you back. There's an idiot in the other stall who keeps answering all my questions

On a roll with lists of humor I have been emailed. PREGNANCY Q & A & much more! Q: Should I have a baby after 35? A: No, 35 children is enough. Q: I'm two months pregnant now. When will my baby move? A: With any luck, right after he finishes college. Q: What is the most reliable method to determine a baby's sex? A: Childbirth. Q: My wife is five months pregnant and so moody that sometimes she's borderline irrational. A: So what's your question? Q: My childbirth instructor says it's not pain I'll feel during labor, but pressure. Is she right? A: Yes, in the same way that a tornado might be called an air current. Q: When is the best time to get an epidural? A: Right after you find out you're pregnant. Q: Is there any reason I have to be in the delivery room while my wife is in labor? A: Not unless the word "alimony" means anything to you. Q: Is there anything I should avoid while recovering from childbirth? A: Yes, pregnancy. Q: Do I have to have a baby shower? A: Not if you change the baby's diaper very quickly. Q: Our baby was born last week. When will my wife begin to feel and act normal again? A: When the kids are in college.

This was ganked from urlLink Pup's blog This is interesting - just another point of view: Things you have to believe to be a Republican today: Jesus loves you, and shares your hatred of homosexuals and Hillary Clinton. Saddam was a good guy when Reagan armed him, a bad guy when Bush's daddy made war on him, a good guy when Cheney did business with him and a bad guy when Bush needed a "we can't find Bin Laden" diversion. Trade with Cuba is wrong because the country is Communist, but trade with China and Vietnam is vital to a spirit of international harmony. The United States should get out of the United Nations, and our highest national priority is enforcing U.N. resolutions against Iraq. A woman can't be trusted with decisions about her own body, but multi-national corporations can make decisions affecting all mankind without regulation. The best way to improve military morale is to praise the troops in speeches while slashing veterans' benefits and combat pay. If condoms are kept out of schools, adolescents won't have sex. A good way to fight terrorism is to belittle our long-time allies, then demand their cooperation and money. Providing health care to all Iraqis is sound policy. Providing health care to all Americans is socialism. HMOs and insurance companies have the best interests of the public at heart. Global warming and tobacco's link to cancer are junk science, but creationism should be taught in schools. A president lying about an extramarital affair is an impeachable offense. A president lying to enlist support for a war in which thousands die is solid defense policy. Government should limit itself to the powers named in the Constitution, which include banning gay marriages and censoring the Internet. The public has a right to know about Hillary's cattle trades, but George Bush's driving record is none of our business. Being a drug addict is a moral failing and a crime, unless you're a conservative radio host. Then it's an illness and you need our prayers for your recovery. You support states' rights, which means Attorney General John Ashcroft can tell states what local voter initiatives they have the right to adopt. What Bill Clinton did in the 1960s is of vital national interest, but what Bush did in the '80s is irrelevant.

WTF This is really a funny ass section of an article on MSN. I wondered if it was real news. I have italicized/colored the lines I find especially funny. Saddam writes poetry, gardens in prison Newspaper: Former Iraqi leader appears 'dejected' The Associated Press Updated: 12:04 p.m. ET July 26, 2004 LONDON - Saddam Hussein appears depressed and demoralized in solitary confinement, spending his time writing poetry, tending a garden and reading the Quran , according to a report published Monday in The Guardian newspaper. advertisement urlLink One of Saddam’s poems is about George Bush , though the report did not specify whether that referred to President Bush or his father, Saddam’s foe in the 1991 Gulf War. The newspaper quoted Bakhtiar Amin, the human rights minister in the new Iraqi government, who said he had visited Saddam’s cell on Saturday. Amin said he did not speak to the former Iraqi leader. Bakhtiar said Saddam appeared “in good health and being kept in good conditions,” but he “appeared demoralized and dejected,” The Guardian reported. Saddam’s air-conditioned cell in a U.S. military prison is 10 feet wide and 13 feet long, Amin said. Saddam is not allowed to mix with other prisoners. Saddam likes American muffins, cookies. Amin had little to report on Saddam’s poetry. “One of the poems is about George Bush, but I had no time to read it,” Amin said. He reported that Saddam was being treated for high blood pressure and a chronic prostate infection, and was gaining weight after losing 11 pounds during a time when he resisted all fatty foods. Saddam and other detainees get an MRE (meal ready to eat) breakfast, and hot food twice a day, Amin said. Dessert might include oranges, apples, pears or plums, but Saddam also likes American muffins and cookies , The Guardian quoted Amin as saying. Saddam is not allowed newspapers, TV or radio, but has access to 145 books — mostly travel books and novels — donated by the Red Cross. Amin said Saddam tends a garden during his daily three-hour exercise period. “He is looking after a few bushes and shrubs and has even placed a circle of white stones around a small palm tree, ” said Amin. “His apparent care for his surroundings is ironic when you think he was responsible for one of the biggest ecocides when he drained the southern marshes.”

OLD LADY Yesterday, to my total dismay, I received in the mail my first statement of SOCIAL SECURITY BENEFITS. Fuck. A defining piece of mail, telling me that I am getting old. Telling me that I can't hang out in the movie theatre parking lot doing nothing anymore. Telling me that I can't have Taco Bell for lunch everyday. Telling me that skipping school now would be so much more trouble than it's worth. Telling me that there isn't any pep rally or football game to go to. Telling me that the times are whizzing by, faster than I could have even imagined.

From Reuters today LOS ANGELES (Reuters) - Pop star Michael Jackson, facing a trial on child molestation charges, is about to become a father to four more children -- quadruplets -- by way of a surrogate mother, Us Weekly magazine reported on Tuesday. Citing unnamed sources close to the self-proclaimed "King of Pop," the magazine said Jackson recently spent time with the pregnant mother-to-be in Florida, where he stayed in a $4,000-a-night luxury hotel suite in Miami Beach. The magazine said Jackson's spokeswoman Raymone Bain declined to confirm or deny the story, saying, "We do not respond to these kinds of stories." Bain could not be immediately reached for comment by Reuters. Jackson, 45, already has three children -- Prince Michael I and daughter Paris Michael by his former wife, Debbie Rowe, and Prince Michael II, the child he notoriously dangled from the balcony of a Berlin hotel in November 2002. Jackson later revealed in a television documentary that Prince Michael II had been born to a woman who was essentially a stranger to him. "I used a surrogate mother and my own sperm cells," he told British interviewer Martin Bashir. "She doesn't know me."

Ok this is great - taken from The Sun By LUCY HAGAN TROUBLED Britney Spears sinks to a new low — swigging whisky and Red Bull and scoffing junk food in the street with her love-rat fiancé. The once-glamorous pop princess, 22, looked a slob as she drifted from one low-budget store to another for lunch with jobless dancer Kevin Federline. First the pair — who have just flown home from a beach holiday in Hawaii — picked up French fries at Neptune’s Net on the Pacific Coast Highway in Malibu. Hic me baby ... Britney emerges from liquor store with whisky miniature and Red Bull Then 15 minutes later, they stopped at sandwich shop Subway for filled rolls and fizzy orange. They left munching bags of cheese and onion Wheatos crisps and salt and vinegar Lays. Finally, came their third stop in 30 minutes — at a liquor store to buy Britney a miniature of Glenlivet whisky. She gulped it down in one, followed by a chaser of caffeine drink Red Bull. Kevin, 26 — who has dumped his seven-months pregnant lover to woo Britney — clutched a bottle of cola and a stuffed grocery bag with a packet of cigs balancing on the top. An onlooker said: “I had to look twice — it didn’t even look like Britney. Her hair was a mess and she looked like she was wearing his jeans, they were so long. Oops I did it again ... singer gorgingon bags of crisps with fiance Kevin “The only giveaway was her bling-bling engagement ring.” Britney — who six months ago wed pal Jason Alexander for 55 hours — has known Kev three months. She proposed to him with a £25,000 ring. The singer has been riding high at No1 with Everytime but has cancelled a world tour because of a knee injury. She was recently pictured looking bloated, spotty and puffing a ciggy. Britney's Malibu diet: Starter: Portion of French fries Main course: A Subway roll, packets of cheese and onion Wheatos and salt and vinegar Lays crisps with a bottle of orangeade Dessert: Miniature bottle of Glenlivet whisky with a Red Bull energy drink chaser

My Girl Fridays Another My Girl Friday success! I got home, (skipped the gym) and headed to Blockbuster. Since I had already watched The Good Girl , I didn't have much left TiVo'ed. I rented Girl with a Pearl Earring , which was a great book by Tracy Chevalier, and Robin Hood, Prince of Thieves . Yes, I know it's an oldie but I had never seen it. Girl with a Pearl Earring was good, mostly because Colin Firth was in it, but there wasn't a lot of dialogue and like always, is missing a lot that was in the book. I think that unless you 1. read the book or 2. love fictional stories about Vermeer paintings, you won't get a whole hell of a lot out of it. As for Robin Hood, Prince of Thieves , I always liked in the Disney version. Although I noted that in the Disney version, Friar Tuck was not a drunk like in the Kevin Costner one. Market value From MSN Careers And the next question is, since it's so important, how do you determine your market value? You start with your compensation and try to ascertain what it should be, the career expert says. "Research comparable salaries and find out what the market pays for someone with your skills and background," said Lee, whose Web site includes that information. "Next, determine what your contribution will be or what it is to the company's bottom line--especially anything you have done or can do to generate revenue and cut costs. And finally, show what you bring to the party, your new ideas, how you've figured out a way to work more efficiently and to work harder, and how you are a team player. "When you do that, you know your worth to yourself and to the company. You know your market value." Lee adds that knowing your market value gives you the confidence to ace a job interview and to get the promotion you want. I asked him if he ever uses "market value" himself. "All the time," the executive responded. "Every day. I'm happy and challenged." If you want to be happy like Lee in this tight and competitive labor market, it's very important to ascertain and list all your attributes. Here are some you might have forgotten that really can make a difference in whether or not you get the job or the promotion. So don't forget to state: - I pay for and bring a box of delicious doughnuts for the entire staff at least once a week. - I know all the best restaurants within a six-block area. - I always hang my coat or jacket in the closet instead of draping it over my chair or desk. - I am the world's best employee. - I never brag.

Hilarious Kenny Rogers Is Father of Twins Jul 6, 6:06 PM EST The Associated Press ATLANTA -- Singer Kenny Rogers and his wife, Wanda, are the parents of identical twin boys. The twins were born Tuesday morning in Atlanta, according to Claire Cook with Dreamcatcher Entertainment. Justin Charles weighed 6 pounds, 10 ounces, and his twin brother, Jordan Edward, weighed 5 pounds, 8 ounces. Wanda Rogers is an identical twin, and twins also run in Kenny Rogers' family, Cook said. The 65-year-old singer has three children from previous marriages. During his long career, Rogers has had dozens of hits on the pop and country charts, including "Lucille," "The Gambler" and "Lady."

How about this?? Prisoner glues himself to girlfriend MADRID, Spain (Reuters) -- A German prisoner in Madrid and his girlfriend glued their hands together during a jail visit in an attempt to fight the man's possible extradition to Germany, judicial sources said on Thursday. The pair were taken to hospital, where doctors were considering whether to operate or use a powerful solvent to separate the man's left hand from the woman's right. The glue is a type normally used in car repairs. Spanish police arrested the 39-year-old man in the southern city of Cadiz in April on request from Germany, where he faces accusations of smuggling women from Eastern Europe to force them into prostitution, the judicial sources said. The Madrid court studying the extradition request will not make a decision for several months, they added. The man has a separate judicial case pending in Spain and authorities want it resolved before any handover to Germany.

Three More Years of Oprah What would we ever do without Oprah in the afternoon? We’ll probably never have to find out. The talk show maven signed with King World Productions to keep the gravy train going through the 2010-11 season, which will be its 25th year in syndication. The new contract between King World and Winfrey’s Harpo Productions calls for a boost in the number of shows each season. Beginning with the 2004-05 season, the number of new episodes will increase from 130 to 140, however, the load drops back to 130 episodes for the last year of the contract in 2011. The Chicago-based program continues to dominate in the ratings, and has ranked first among talk shows for 71 consecutive "sweeps" periods. The program airs on more than 200 U.S. stations and is distributed to more than 100 other countries. Photo Copyright Getty Images Thank God! I desperately wanted to go to Oprah when I was in Chicago last weekend but it seems that you have to get tickets 100 years in advance! Hopefully I can make it there by 2011!

THE VOTE So Missourian's primaries were this week and I have to say I am a little disgruntled., but I guess not surprised, with the results. I wonder if the Midwest will ever change how it looks at things. I think the mentality is kin to that of the 1950's. Naturally I read in the NY Times that Missouri's proposed amendment regarding their pinheaded non-acceptance of gay marriage will set the precedent for other states' primaries. That is something to be proud of now, isn't it? The main argument I hear against this is that it destroys the institution of marriage. Well I didn't know it was so sacred. Divorce rates are hilariously high. Especially today - don't you think it's healthier to be with the person you love than stuck in a situation that makes you miserable? I think that is a weak position to take on it. I would like to examine the marriages of those who argue this platform. I am sure that we will find that everything is peaches and cream. Oh wait, probably not, assholes. I just can't see why it matters? Is it better to make people unhappy just so you can hide behind your Bible and feel better about your hypocritical ass? Does this make you a better person?
